p: RRV is endemic in Australia, Papua New Guinea and islands of the South Pacific and causes disease in humans and horses. RRVâ€™s geographic range was thought to be limited by the distribution of its primary reservoir hosts, initially believed to be marsupials. However, recent evidence suggests that RRV circulates endemically in the Pacific Islands, where marsupials are absent [ 14]. In addition, RRV is a vector generalist able to be transmitted by 40 species of mosquito, which poses a serious risk of wider dissemination [ 15].
